problem: What is the angle formed between the hour hand and the minute hand of a clock when it's 3:00 PM?

questions.question: What is the position of the hour hand at 3:00 PM?
options: Pointing directly at the number 2 on the clock face.
Pointing directly at the number 3 on the clock face. (Correct answer)
Pointing directly at the number 4 on the clock face.
Pointing directly at the number 5 on the clock face.

hints.description: The two lines on the clock form an angle. | [Angle formed between the hour hand and the minute hand of a clock]

questions.question: What is the position of the minute hand at 3:00 PM?
options: Pointing directly at the number 6 on the clock face.
Pointing directly at the number 8 on the clock face.
Pointing directly at the number 10 on the clock face.
Pointing directly at the number 12 on the clock face. (Correct answer)

hints.description: The two lines on the clock form an angle. | [Angle formed between the hour hand and the minute hand of a clock]

problem: What is the double-angle identity for sine?

problem: What is the sum-to-product identity for sine?

questions.question: What is the formula for the sum-to-product identity for sine?
options: sin(θ) + sin(φ) = sin((θ + φ)/2) + cos((θ - φ)/2)
sin(θ) + sin(φ) = sin((θ - φ)/2) + cos((θ + φ)/2)

hints.description: See the values of trigonometric functions. | [Some common values of trigonometric function-part 3]
See the values of trigonometric functions. | [Some common values of trigonometric function-part 4]
It relates the sum of two angles to the product of their sines. | [sum-to-product identity for sine function]

problem: What is the complementary angle theorem for sine and cosine?

questions.question: What is the relationship between the sine and cosine of complementary angles?

hints.description: Sum of the opposite angle and adjacent are always 90 degrees. | [Relation between the angles of the right angle triangle]
It states that the sine of an angle is equal to the cosine of its complementary angle. | [Complementary angle theorem for sine and cosine]

problem: What is the cofunction identity for sine and cosine?

questions.question: What is the cofunction identity relating sine and cosine?

hints.description: Sum of the opposite angle and adjacent are always 90 degrees. | [Relation between the angles of the right angle triangle]
It states that the sine of an angle is equal to the cosine of its complementary angle. | [Complementary angle theorem for sine and cosine]

problem: What is the cofunction identity for tangent and cotangent?

questions.question: What is the cofunction identity relating tangent and cotangent?

hints.description: Sum of the opposite angle and adjacent are always 90 degrees. | [Relation between the angles of the right angle triangle]

The cofunction identity for tangent and cotangent shows that the tangent of an angle is equal to the cotangent of its complementary angle and vice versa. | [Cofunction identity for tangent and cotangent]

questions.question: What is the cofunction identity of tangent and cotangent for angles θ and 90 - θ?

hints.description: Sum of the opposite angle and adjacent are always 90 degrees. | [Relation between the angles of the right angle triangle]

The cofunction identity for tangent and cotangent shows that the tangent of an angle is equal to the cotangent of its complementary angle and vice versa. | [Cofunction identity for tangent and cotangent]
